name: Single Leg Push-Up
description: The Single Leg Push-Up works your lower-abdomincal muscles and places more demand on your chest and serratus anterior, an important posture muscle that runs from your chest and along your rib cage to your shoulder blade
focuses: Place your right hand in a standard pushup position
Move your left hand a few inches forward
Raise your right leg and then lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor
Push back to the starting position
Do half your reps, then switch arms and lefs and finish your set
